title: Have COVID-19 shutdowns inadvertently decreased the spread of the flu and other contagious diseases? - Quora

response.answer_text: Have COVID-19 shutdowns inadvertently decreased the spread of the flu and other contagious diseases? It has certainly helped Mongolia control the H3N2 influenza outbreak. H3N2 flu cases dropped 90 percent. During the start of the flu season last year almost 12.7 percent of all hospital visits were due to the flu; this year it was 1.8 percent. Mongolia Finds a Silver Living in the COVID-19 Crisis

When people are physically isolated from each other, contagious diseases have fewer opportunities to spread. After all, I can’t catch the flu from Aunt Wheezy if she and I stay isolated in our separate homes.
